column5: I accept that having only a minority shareholding in Aer Lingus affects the Government's ability to maintain the air link with Britain as a strategic State-owned asset.  It is difficult not to see, however, how in an island nation transport links to our nearest neighbour cannot be described as a strategic asset.  Can the Minister say what in his area is considered a strategic asset?  I wonder whether our ports and harbours are considered to be strategic assets.
Are they up for consideration in terms of possible sale after the recommendations of the McCarthy report and the troika?
